intro: Argostemma timorense, commonly known as the Timor argostemma, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow corona. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical forests.
